questions.question: What are the general rules regarding the issue of an AOC?
options: Operators must own enough aeroplanes to conduct safe operations
Aeroplanes should be registered in the state where the AOC is issued
Operators must be certified in accordance with EASA part 145
The Accountable Manager must be the holder of a full ATPL
questions.solution: Aeroplanes should be registered in the state where the AOC is issued

questions.question: What must be stated on the AOC?
options: Name of the Accountable Manager
Registration markings of all aeroplanes
Aerodrome operating minima for all aerodromes cleared for use
Date of expiry of the AOC
questions.solution: Registration markings of all aeroplanes; Aerodrome operating minima for all aerodromes cleared for use

questions.question: Where would a pilot find the MEL for his aeroplane?
options: AFM
Ops Manual part C
Ops Manual part B
Company Procedures Manual

questions.question: Can the Ops Manual be stored electronically?
options: Yes but not on the aircraft
No
Yes
Yes but only on the aircraft
questions.solution: Yes but not on the aircraft

questions.question: What language must the Ops Manual normally be produced in?
options: English
French
Spanish
All major languages used in the EU
questions.solution: All major languages used in the EU

questions.question: If, during the pre-flight inspection, the pilot notices an aerial missing from the airframe:
options: he must refer to the CDL, and if it is listed he can continue
he must refer to the MEL and if it is listed he can continue
he must report it after flight
he must report it before flight
questions.solution: he must refer to the MEL and if it is listed he can continue
